comments.raw_text: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.1.1) Gecko/20061204 Firefox/2.0.0.1 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.1.1) Gecko/20061204 Firefox/2.0.0.1 Images do not display if full URI is specified in and image is in domain / server than the page on which the reference occurs. Example: in http://waterbok.co.za/Tuis/Tuisblad.htm - image does not display. Image displays when image URI is entered in address bar - eg. http://www.dieknoop.co.za/dieknoop.gif When image is copied to same domain as page, it displays - eg. in http://waterbok.co.za/Tuis/Tuisblad.htm Also displays if relative location is used after copying eg. - normal condition for local images Problem also occurs when Image does not display The exact pages referred to above all work in Internet Explorer Problem first noticed in Firefox 2.0, still a problem in 2.0.0.1 Unable to test in Firefox 1.5 now, but 90% sure problem did not occur there Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. On a web page, refer to an image in a different domain. See "Details" above. 2. 3. Actual Results: Image does not display if in different domain Expected Results: Should always display
comments.creator: vtonderjc@outlook.com
comments.text: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.1.1) Gecko/20061204 Firefox/2.0.0.1 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.1.1) Gecko/20061204 Firefox/2.0.0.1 Images do not display if full URI is specified in and image is in domain / server than the page on which the reference occurs. Example: in http://waterbok.co.za/Tuis/Tuisblad.htm - image does not display. Image displays when image URI is entered in address bar - eg. http://www.dieknoop.co.za/dieknoop.gif When image is copied to same domain as page, it displays - eg. in http://waterbok.co.za/Tuis/Tuisblad.htm Also displays if relative location is used after copying eg. - normal condition for local images Problem also occurs when Image does not display The exact pages referred to above all work in Internet Explorer Problem first noticed in Firefox 2.0, still a problem in 2.0.0.1 Unable to test in Firefox 1.5 now, but 90% sure problem did not occur there Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. On a web page, refer to an image in a different domain. See "Details" above. 2. 3. Actual Results: Image does not display if in different domain Expected Results: Should always display
comments.author: vtonderjc@outlook.com
vtonderjc@outlook.com
comments.text:
Actual example:

Using Firefox 2: On http://www.vcho.co.za/tuis/soek.htm , enter a word and do a search.

Do the same on Internet explorer and compare the headers of the search results pages.
comments.creator: vtonderjc@outlook.com

Actual example:

comments.author: bugzilla@mversen.de
comments.text:
type "about:config" in the url bar (without the "") and set permissions.default.image to "1".
If this value is already on "1" start Firefox in teh Firefox safemode.
comments.creator: bugzilla@mversen.de
comments.raw_text:
type "about:config" in the url bar (without the "") and set permissions.default.image to "1".
If this value is already on "1" start Firefox in teh Firefox safemode.

(In reply to comment #2)
> type "about:config" in the url bar (without the "") and set
> permissions.default.image to "1".
> If this value is already on "1" start Firefox in teh Firefox safemode.
> 
permissions.default.image was set to "3" (How it got changed  / which program or extension did that, I would like to know - that is probably where the bug is!)
Setting permissions.default.image to the default of "1" resolved the problem. 

This particular bug may be closed as invalid/resolved.

Thanks for the quick and valuable feedback. I should have reported the problem when I first saw it!

Thanks for the quick and valuable feedback. I should have reported the problem when I first saw it!
